content: 🛠️ Kadena has two main GitHub repositories: 1. https://github.com/kadena-io 2. https://github.com/kadena-community | Both are official repositories by the Kadena team, no community repositories.
title: Official GitHub Repositories

content:
🧪 Testnet Portal of Kadena: http://testnet.chainweb.com/
Fund accounts on testnet via https://tools.kadena.io/faucet/existing for existing accounts and https://tools.kadena.io/faucet/new for new accounts [Goliath faucet has nothing to do with it]. The faucet will give you 100 KDA per request for the chain you select (chain 0-19)
title: Testnet and Faucet Information

content:
🧩 Nodes for Kadena including setup here: https://docs.kadena.io/contribute/node
[IMPORTANT: Nodes can not be used to mine KDA. You need an ASIC miner by Bitmain, Goldshell, or iBeLink. Those are all three manufacturers that produce those ASIC miners. No one else produces them right now.]
title: Node Setup and Mining Requirements

content:
🔍Official Block Explorer: https://explorer.chainweb.com/mainnet and a great third party explorer by Eucalyptus Labs:: https://kdaexplorer.com/

⚖️ Official Balance Checker to check the balance of KDA and other tokens: https://balance.chainweb.com/
💫 Simple Javascript Tools to transfer Kadena coins: https://transfer.chainweb.com/
To finish or finalize a cross-chain transaction that got stuck, you can use https://tools.kadena.io/transactions/cross-chain-transfer-finisher or https://transfer.chainweb.com/xchain.html [the KDA Command line tool or Chainweaver won't work for that request]
title: Block Explorers and Transaction Tools

content: 🌱Is there a website listing all the projects building on Kadena? Projects on Kadena can be found here: https://www.kadena.io/ecosystem or here: https://kadenaecosystem.com (Even those who aren't endorsed by the official team )

content:
Team Size
The team size of Kadena is currently at ~70 team members. The team size of Kadena is currently at ~70 team members.
title: Kadena Team Size

content:
Roadmap
We at Kadena are transitioning to a new strategy for our roadmaps and project announcements. Rather than following a set roadmap, we plan to offer broad, transparent updates. Our commitment is to build in public, sharing daily details about our work, including partnerships, projects, and tools.

Shifting away from traditional announcement models, we've embraced what we call the 'Marvel Universe model', openly outlining our ongoing projects and keeping everyone updated on their progress. We understand the pitfalls of unrealistic launch dates, which can lead to failure either through missed deadlines or rushed subpar products. To set ourselves up for success, our focus is on transparency and launching products only when they are fully ready.

Our roadmap is a modular one. Anyone in the community can use the following Figma file to create their own version of a roadmap and use it on their socials.

Find the roadmap here: https://www.kadena.io/roadmap
title: Kadena Roadmap Strategy

content:
Staking
There's no 'native' staking as such as Kadena is Proof of Work (PoW) and not Proof of Stake (PoS).
title: Staking on Kadena

content:
Kadenswap
Kadenaswap is the DEX infrastructure built by Kadena. It is not a DEX but rather a framework everyone can build upon. Projects that use the Kadenaswap infrastructure are eckoDAO and KDSwap.
title: Kadenswap DEX Infrastructure

content:
How to Mine KDA | Mining KDA / Kadena
There's three primary ways:

1) Find and buy your own ASIC miner, either buy directly from a seller like Bitmain and then plug it in at your house to a 240V power source, choose a mining pool, and set your ASIC to start mining

2) Choose a hosting provider to host your ASIC for you. You buy the asic and send it to your hosting provider, they charge you for electricity, make sure it keeps running, and you get the mining rewards

3) Chips.finance lets you simply pay for an ASIC, pay for hosting, and you can start mining right away.

Q: What is CHIPS?
A: CHIPS is an innovative tokenised real world assets (RWA) DeFi project with a focus on generating yield from proof-of-work (PoW) crypto mining and separately tokenised energy built on the Kadena blockchain.
To find out more you can read this Medium article by Chips' CTO Jad for an intro to CHIPS https://medium.com/@todd_chips/welcome-to-chips-revolutionizing-cryptocurrency-mining-7eabec03cdb4 or you can watch the video here if you prefer a video https://chips-1.gitbook.io/chips.finance-documentation
For further details please read our full project white paper on the website https://phoenixforgeusa.com/chips
title: How to Mine KDA and CHIPS Information

content:

Poolflare - https://poolflare.net/coin/kda/pool (26% of hashrate - March 2024)
DXPool - https://www.dxpool.com/
Hashpool - https://hashpool.com/
Poolmars - https://poolmars.net/
title: Kadena Mining Pools

content:
ASIC Miners on Kadena
The following are the only manufacturers of ASIC miners for Kadena: Bitmain, Goldshell, iBeLink. The hashing algorithm is blake2s_256. KDA can't be mined with GPUs or mining nodes!
Here are the miners incl. the hashrate and power consumption
- Bitmain Antminer KA3 166TH Kadena Miner 3154W
- Goldshell KD Box II 5TH Kadena Miner 400W
- Goldshell KD BOX Pro 2.6Th/s Kadena Miner 230W
- Goldshell KD LITE KDA Miner 16.2 Th/s 1330W
- Goldshell KD Max KDA Miner 40.2 Th/s 3350W
- Goldshell Kd5 18 Th/s Kadena Miner 2250W
- Goldshell KD5 Pro 24.5Th/s Kadena Miner 3000W
- Goldshell KD6 29.2Th/s Kadena Miner 2630W
- Goldshell KD6 SE 25.3Th/s Kadena Miner 2300W
- Goldshell KDA Box Home Miner Kadena1600 Gh/s 205W
- iBeLink BM K1+ 15Th/s KDA Kadena Miner 2250W
- iBeLink BM-K1 5.3Th/s KDA Kadena Miner 835W
- iBeLink BM-K1 Max 32Th/s KDA Kadena Miner 3200W
- iBeLink BM-K3 Max Kadena Miner 3200W
- iBeLink BM-K3 Mini Kadena Miner 290W
- iBeLink K3 KDA Kadena Miner 3300W
title: ASIC Miners and Hardware Specifications
Overview of Kadena and Chainweb Architecture
content: Kadena is a Layer‑1 blockchain network launched in 2016 by Stuart Popejoy and Will Martino. It uses a unique Proof‑of‑Work protocol called Chainweb. Rather than processing all transactions on a single chain like Bitcoin, Chainweb runs many independent blockchains in parallel and braids their block hashes together. This braided multi‑chain design enables Kadena to increase transaction throughput by adding more chains while still maintaining security, decentralization and energy efficiency. By combining multiple chains with braided hashes, Chainweb can scale horizontally without compromising the security guarantees of proof‑of‑work.

title: Chainweb EVM and EVM Compatibility
content: Chainweb EVM is Kadena’s Ethereum‑compatible execution environment. It introduces full EVM support on Kadena’s network so developers can deploy Solidity smart contracts natively while benefiting from Kadena’s scalability and speed. Chainweb EVM runs on multiple parallel EVM chains and offers ultra‑low gas fees, providing a familiar toolset for Ethereum developers without the high costs normally associated with EVM chains.

title: Multi‑Chain Architecture, High Throughput and Low Fees
content: Kadena’s braided multi‑chain architecture enables high throughput and low transaction fees. Transactions are processed across many chains at once, allowing the network to handle a large number of transfers in parallel. This design keeps transaction fees extremely low and provides a scalable foundation for dApps and users. Developers and institutions can build on a scalable multi‑chain architecture with high throughput and minimal fees.

title: Leadership and Founders
content: Kadena was founded by Stuart Popejoy and Will Martino. The wider Kadena team includes alumni from JP Morgan, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Moody’s and Goldman Sachs. This mix of traditional finance, regulatory and technology experience informs Kadena’s approach to building a secure and compliant blockchain platform.

title: Kadena Token Supply and Market Data
content: KDA is the native token of the Kadena network. The total supply is capped at one billion tokens, with roughly 327 million KDA in circulation as of August 2025. The live market capitalization is around $146 million and price and supply metrics can be verified on data sites like CoinMarketCap. KDA’s issuance is distributed over several decades through mining and other allocations.

title: KDA Trading Availability and Exchanges
content: KDA tokens are listed on major cryptocurrency exchanges, making them accessible to traders worldwide. Trading platforms include Binance, Bybit, OKX, Gate.io, KuCoin, Bitget, MEXC and Crypto.com Exchange. Common trading pairs are KDA/USDT, KDA/BTC and KDA/USD. Availability on multiple exchanges provides liquidity and ease of access for users.

title: Kadena Ecosystem Projects Count
content: The Kadena Ecosystem website tracks projects and dApps built on the Kadena network. It lists more than 100 projects building on Kadena and aims to make information about the ecosystem easily accessible to the community. The growing number of projects reflects the network’s expanding developer base and application diversity.
